newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Large Causeway shareholders sell stakes. [corrected 11:20 gmt]
newsitem.headline: Large Causeway shareholders sell stakes. [corrected 11:20 gmt]

text.p: Trading firm Causeway Investment Ltd said on Thursday three large shareholders had sold their stakes in the company.
Causeway said in a statement the sales, all on October 10 and by shareholders with addresses in Malaysia, involved a total of 9.82 million shares.
Based on the total number of shares on May 13 1996, this would be equivalent to approximately 13.9 percent (Corrects from 32.6 percent) of Causeway's shares, according to the company's annual report.
Causeway topped the actives board of the Stock Exchange of Singapore on Thursday with 15.91 million shares traded.
The stock closed two cents lower at Singapore $1.42.
The statement said Goh Teong Hoe had sold 3.62 million shares, while Tunku Osman Ahmad had sold 3.03 million and Ong Tee Thong had sold 3.18 million.
According to the company's annual report, the shareholders were three of the company's four largest investors in May.
The statement did not say at what price the shares had been sold or give details of the buyer or buyers of the stock.
